title: Sources: Northwestern hiring Chip Kelly as OC
content: Veteran coach Chip Kelly, who won a national title at Ohio State in 2024 as offensive coordinator, is joining Northwestern as its new OC, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Tuesday.

title: Nuggets' Jokic limps off court after injuring knee
content: Nuggets star Nikola Jokic limped off the court at halftime of Denver's game in Miami on Monday night after injuring his left knee with about three seconds left before the intermission. He will have an MRI on Tuesday.

title: Sources: Colts to start Leonard over Rivers at QB
content: The Colts are expected to start rookie quarterback Riley Leonard on Sunday against the Texans, sources told Stephen Holder and Jeremy Fowler on Tuesday.

title: Father of NASCAR's Hamlin dies after house fire
content: Denny Hamlin's father died and his mother was critically injured after a weekend fire heavily damaged the North Carolina home where they lived.

title: Report: Watchdog didn't close case against coach
content: The U.S. Center for SafeSport, an Olympics watchdog agency, failed to levy its harshest sanctions against former gymnastics coach Sean Gardner.

title: Tiger turns 50, now eligible for Champions tour
content: Tiger Woods turned 50 on Tuesday, making the 15-time major championship winner eligible to compete on the PGA Tour Champions circuit once he recovers from his latest health setbacks.

title: Brees, Fitzgerald lead Pro Football HOF finalists
content: Quarterback Drew Brees and wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald headline a group of four modern era finalists in their first year of eligibility for the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: Riley won't return as Clemson OC after 7-6 season
content: Two days after the season ended with a 22-10 loss to Penn State in the Pinstripe Bowl, Clemson coach Dabo Swinney announced Monday that offensive coordinator Garrett Riley and safeties coach Mickey Conn will not return to the Tigers' program next season.

title: üèà 26 QBs to watch in CFB transfer portal
content: From top targets to top backups, we've tiered QBs ahead of the transfer portal officially opening Jan. 2.

title: 'We found our guy': Texas Tech's gamble on a high school coaching legend has paid off
content: Joey McGuire has his team in the quarterfinals of the CFP, but he was a relative unknown when he was hired.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus what we learned about each team this season
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings one more time ahead of Week 18. We also picked out lessons for all 32 teams in 2025.

title: Can Texas Tech billionaire booster Cody Campbell fix college sports?
content: Texas Tech's billionaire booster has turned the Red Raiders into a powerhouse. Can he fix college sports next?

title: 23 years, 23 photos: LeBron James' career, told through images
content: From The Block to poster dunks, here's a look back at the 23 photos that define James' 23-year NBA career.

title: Bracketology: Vanderbilt is exceeding expectations as a projected 2-seed
content: The unbeaten 'Dores weren't expected to be this good this season, but we could very well see history made in March.

title: Bracketology: Are the top seeds already decided?
content: March is months away, but UConn, Texas, South Carolina, UCLA and LSU look locked in on the top two seed lines.

title: Which NBA star had the best year? The 2025 Golden Basketball goes to ...
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton breaks down which NBA stars had the best year from January to December and crowns a winner.

title: From Liverpool to Chelsea, ranking 8 Premier League clubs' transfer needs
content: The January transfer window is about to open, so let's look at which Premier League teams need to make moves to improve for the rest of the season.

title: Inside Jakob Chychrun's breakout: The big goals, 'unique' diet and Olympic pressures
content: The 27-year-old defenseman may be the Capitals' MVP to this point. Here's how he leveled up in 2025-26.

title: Our favorite MLB games of 2025: World Series Game 7, four-homer performances and much more
content: From playoff thrillers to epic individual achievements, these are the moments we'll remember for decades to come.

title: How all 17 weeks of the NFL season led us here: Barnwell sorts what mattered and what didn't
content: Bill Barnwell picked out what most impacted the NFL playoff hunt across the entire season, from the Lions' dud in Week 1 to the Steelers' struggles Sunday.

title: Why NFL uniform rules have players feeling like a 'mannequin'
content: While NBA players rock sneakers of various colors, the NFL has strict rules, and violators can incur hefty fines.

title: Free agent pickups: Look to Saints, Titans amid Week 18 uncertainty
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we dive into Week 18, the final week of the fantasy football season.

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: The Usos are tag team champions again
content: Jey and Jimmy Uso take back the tag titles on 'Raw,' setting the stage for more championship action on Jan. 5.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Yildiz as Salah replacement
content: Liverpool are interested in signing Juventus star Kenan Yildiz as Mohamed Salah replacement. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Early Week 18 bets: Ravens-Steelers to be a slugfest; Drake Maye for MVP
content: Which lines offered value once odds came out? Here are games we are eyeing for bets going into Week 18.

title: Pickups: Add Anthony Black, Cedric Coward before it's too late
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Watch: Vande Bharat clocks 180kmph; passes 'water test'
content: Vande Bharat sleeper train has touched the 180 kmph speed mark during speed trials by the Commissioner Railway Safety. The new train set is a sleeper variant of the popular Vande Bharat chair car service and is set to be launched soon.

title: 2025: The year America normalised anti-India hate
content: Not to White Castle specifically, but to a sort of ‚Äòwhite castle‚Äô: where you are so integrated and assimilated that you are considered a beacon of society, an upstanding member of the Shining City on the Top of The Hill. A place where your faith was acceptable as all the other faiths that existed in the American tapestry.

title: Retirement that stunned Indian cricket - How Dhoni's Test career ended
content: Without any ceremony, 44 minutes after MS Dhoni finished his post-match press conference following the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the BCCI sent out a press release. The news came an hour after India had managed to draw an away Test ‚Äî the first time in the previous 14 Australia-India Tests that the visiting team had not lost.

title: Google‚Äôs AI comeback: From ‚ÄòEat Glue‚Äô disaster to beating ChatGPT; How Gemini won 2025
content: Google's AI comeback, spearheaded by Gemini 3, has shaken OpenAI, forcing CEO Sam Altman to issue a 'code red'.  Following earlier stumbles, a dream team including Demis Hassabis and Sergey Brin revitalized the company.  Gemini's user base surged, surpassing ChatGPT in app store rankings and challenging OpenAI's enterprise dominance, marking a significant shift in the AI landscape.

title: Khalida Zia death: EAM Jaishankar to attend funeral in Dhaka; PM Modi pays tribute
content: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar will attend the funeral of former Bangladesh Prime Minister Begum Khaleda Zia in Dhaka. Prime Minister Narendra Modi remembered Zia's significant contributions to Bangladesh's development and India-Bangladesh relations, recalling a warm meeting in 2015. Zia, a pivotal figure in restoring democracy, passed away at 80 after a long political career.

title: 5th T20I: Why is Mandhana not playing? All you need to know
content: Smriti Mandhana was rested for India‚Äôs fifth T20I against Sri Lanka as the hosts made two changes despite leading the series 4‚Äì0. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur confirmed Mandhana and Renuka Singh Thakur were given a break, with 17-year-old G Kamalini making her debut and Sneh Rana returning. Sri Lanka won the toss and opted to bowl in Thiruvananthapuram.

title: Chinese billionaire‚Äôs plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 kids; wants US-borns to run video game biz
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.

title: 'PKR 11,000 daily allowance': Pay dispute rocks Pakistan hockey
content: Pakistan's senior hockey players are threatening to boycott the upcoming FIH Pro League phase due to a payment dispute. Players allege they received significantly less daily allowance than promised for matches played in Argentina. The Pakistan Hockey Federation cites the Pakistan Sports Board's USD 40 daily allowance policy as the reason for the discrepancy.

title: 'Do I get credit?' Trump repeats 8 wars claim; hot mic moment goes viral
content: US President Donald Trump again claimed he resolved the India-Pakistan conflict, stating he mediated an "immediate" ceasefire. However, India maintains the cessation of hostilities was a result of direct military talks, with Prime Minister Modi clarifying no foreign leader requested India to halt its operations.

title: NY 2026 WhatsApp features: How to use stickers, video call effects; Stepwise method
content: WhatsApp is enhancing New Year's Eve celebrations with new party-themed features. Users can now utilize a 2026 sticker package, video call effects like fireworks and confetti, animated confetti reactions for instant visual celebrations, and animated stickers for status updates. These tools aim to make virtual interactions more engaging and memorable for users worldwide.

title: 'No Christmas for me': National champ at 31, Gurjoat has just begun | Exclusive
content: Thirty-one-year-old skeet shooter Gurjoat Singh Khangura won his maiden national title at the 68th National Shooting Shotgun Championship in Delhi, capping a year of technical changes and setbacks. Calling it just the beginning, Gurjoat sees the gold as a boost toward international selection, Asian Games goals and World Cup medals, stressing discipline, maturity and India‚Äôs rising skeet standards.

title: Tripura student murder: Cops refute ‚Äòracial attack‚Äô angle; one of 5 accused from Manipur
content: Uttarakhand CM assures strict punishment for the culprits in the alleged racial murder of Tripura student Anjel Chakma, with a special team dispatched to Nepal to apprehend the absconding accused. While the CM expressed deep sorrow and pledged exemplary punishment, preliminary findings suggest the racial slurs might have been misconstrued.

title: ‚ÄòUnsportsmanlike behaviour‚Äô: Aronian blasts Carlsen‚Äôs table slam
content: World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen once again found himself in the spotlight, not for his chess moves, but for his angry reaction at the board. The incident happened on Monday during the World Blitz Championship in Doha, after Carlsen lost to India‚Äôs Arjun Erigaisi. Chris Bird, the arbiter who was on duty during the game, later explained what happened.

title: Major disruption at Channel Tunnel: Eurostar cancels all services; chaos erupts at train stations
content: Eurostar has halted all services due to a critical power supply issue in the Channel Tunnel, exacerbated by a stalled Le Shuttle train. This has led to widespread cancellations and severe delays, impacting travelers during the busy post-Christmas period. Passengers are urged to reschedule journeys as disruptions are expected to persist.

title: Cracks in Mahayuti? Athawale cries 'betrayal' over exclusion from seat-sharing for BMC polls
content: Union minister Ramdas Athawale expressed his disappointment, calling the RPI(A)'s exclusion from the BJP-Shiv Sena seat-sharing for BMC polls a "betrayal of trust." Despite this, his party will contest 38 seats independently to uphold worker dignity and Ambedkarite community participation in governance, while still supporting the broader Mahayuti alliance on other seats.

title: 'Over-the-top': China sees red over Salman's Galwan trailer; cries distortion of 'facts'
content: Chinese state media, Global Times, has criticized Salman Khan's upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan,' accusing it of distorting facts about the 2020 Galwan Valley clashes. The movie, inspired by the deadly confrontation, features Khan as an Indian Army officer. Despite the film's portrayal, the PLA remains resolute in defending China's territory, according to the publication.

title: Huge blow! Rapid weight loss delays Shreyas Iyer's return to competitive cricket
content: Shreyas Iyer‚Äôs return to competitive cricket has hit a roadblock, with the India ODI vice-captain yet to receive the required clearance from the BCCI Centre of Excellence (CoE).

title: Defining moment: India now 4th largest economy; what is 'Goldilocks' phase?
content: India has emerged as the world‚Äôs fourth-largest economy, overtaking Japan, and is projected to challenge Germany for the third spot within the next three years. The government remains confident about sustaining growth momentum despite global trade uncertainties.

title: CBSE Class 10th and 12th exams scheduled for March 3 have been postponed: Check new dates here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has revised the Class 10 and Class 12 exam schedule for papers earlier fixed on March 3, 2026. Due to administrative reasons, the Class 10 exam will now be held on March 11, while the Class 12 Legal Studies paper has been postponed to April 10. All other exam dates remain unchanged.

title: Was Putin at home during 'drone attack'? Kremlin responds; Kyiv says no 'plausible evidence'
content: Russia claims its stance on peace deals will harden after an alleged Ukrainian drone attack on President Putin's residence, a charge Kyiv denies, calling it a fabricated claim with no evidence.  India's Prime Minister Modi expressed concern and urged restraint, emphasizing diplomacy as the path to peace.

title: 'Suryakumar used to message me': Actress Khushi Mukherjee drops bombshell
content: "I don't want to date any cricketer. There are so many cricketers after me. Suryakumar Yadav used to message me a lot," Khushi said.

title: 'A Dushasana has come to Bengal': Mamta Banerjee hits back at Amit Shah, denies 'no land' charge
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee retaliated against Union Home Minister Amit Shah, comparing him to Mahabharata characters Duryodhana and Dushasana. She accused the BJP of harassing citizens during voter list revisions and using illegal immigration as a political tool. Shah had earlier criticized the state government for corruption and fear, promising a revival of Bengal's heritage under BJP rule

title: 'Body reduced to skeletal frame': Rtd railway employee, daughter held in captivity; starved by servants
content: A shocking incident in Jhansi saw a retired railway employee and his mentally ill daughter allegedly held captive for five years by their servants. The father died from neglect, while the daughter was found severely malnourished. Relatives discovered the horrific conditions upon visiting after the father's death, leading to a police investigation into alleged property greed.

title: Trump tantrums: How 2025 became a 'Big Bang' year for Indian economy
content: India's 2025 witnessed a 'big bang' of reforms, including tax relief, simplified GST, and liberalized FDI in insurance and pensions. These sweeping changes, aimed at boosting 'ease of living' and 'doing business,' seek to counter global headwinds and attract investment. The ambitious push signals a strategic reset for sustained growth and India's developed economy goal.

title: Punjab shocker: Wife of former top govt lawyer found dead; servant tied to chair
content: A shocking incident in Mohali saw Ashok Kumari Goyal, wife of a former Additional Advocate General, found strangled in her home. The family's servant was discovered tied up, with police suspecting a robbery gone awry. Valuables and cash are reported missing, and the accused are still at large. The servant's account has raised suspicions, leading to his detention for questioning.

title: Fog mayhem: Multiple vehicles collide on Delhi‚ÄìSonipat road, several injured
content: Dense fog on the Delhi-Sonipat road led to a multi-vehicle collision Monday morning, injuring one to two individuals.  Eyewitnesses reported a chain reaction, with one car initially hitting another, followed by a third vehicle striking the stationary, damaged car. Police and emergency services responded promptly to the scene.

title: ‚ÄòCM not capable?‚Äô Sanjay Raut jibes Fadnavis; questions PM, Yogi‚Äôs invovlement in BMC polls
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut criticized the BJP's reliance on national leaders for local BMC polls, questioning the Maharashtra BJP's capability. He also slammed Eknath Shinde's faction for compromising on seat-sharing with the BJP, calling it a betrayal of Marathi pride and a misfortune for the people.

title: Sunny Leone‚Äôs Mathura gig cancelled: Seers fume over New Year event
content: A New Year's Eve program featuring actress Sunny Leone at a Mathura hotel was cancelled due to strong objections from religious leaders. Organizers cited respect for the Braj region's traditions and the sentiments of the saint community as reasons for the decision, despite preparations being complete and all norms being followed.

title: IND vs SA: After MCG 'unsatisfactory' call; ICC releases Kolkata, Guwahati pitch ratings
content: The Eden Gardens pitch for the India-South Africa Test, which ended in three days, received a 'satisfactory' rating despite a low-scoring affair.  While India's coach defended it as a test of skill, the batting coach noted unexpected, early turn.  In contrast, the MCG's two-day Ashes Test pitch was deemed 'unsatisfactory'.

title: Mohanlal's Mother Passes Away: Santhakumari Amma dies at 90; tributes pour in from film fraternity
content: Veteran actor Mohanlal's mother, Santhakumari Amma, passed away at 90 after a prolonged illness. A pillar of strength for her family, she remained a grounding presence despite her son's superstardom. Mohanlal often credited her unwavering support as instrumental to his career. Her mortal remains are expected to be taken to Thiruvananthapuram for final rites.

title: ‚ÄòDhurandhar‚Äô nears milestone at 700 cr; Kartik‚Äôs film struggles to hit 30 cr
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office reign, crossing Rs 700 crore after 26 days. Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' struggles, earning only Rs 25.54 crore in its first week.

title: 'Treated as infiltrators': Adhir Ranjan meets PM; flags 'violence against migrant workers'
content: Prime Minister Modi met Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury to discuss attacks on Bengali-speaking individuals in BJP-ruled states. Chowdhury highlighted administrative confusion between "Banglabhasi" and "Bangladeshi" people, leading to unjust detentions. This meeting precedes West Bengal's 2026 assembly elections, while Union Minister Amit Shah is also in the state reviewing BJP's poll preparedness.

title: Watch: CCTV captures moment when BEST bus ploughed into pedestrians in Mumbai; 4 dead
content: Tragedy struck Bhandup (West) railway station late Monday night as a BEST bus veered off course during a U-turn, crashing into pedestrians. The devastating incident claimed four lives and left ten others injured. CCTV footage captured the bus losing control, hitting a pole before mounting the footpath.

title: Quad envoy vows 'free and open' Indo-Pacific amid Chinese drills around Taiwan
content: US ambassador David Perdue reaffirmed the Quad's commitment to a free and open Indo-Pacific amid escalating regional tensions. The meeting with Quad partners in Beijing occurred as China conducted large-scale military exercises around Taiwan. The Quad's partnership remains strong, aiming to maintain a rules-based order in the region.

title: Jake Paul & Jutta Leerdam net worth in 2025: Boxing, Olympics and business deals
content: Power couple Jake Paul and Jutta Leerdam boast a combined net worth of $205 million in 2025.  Paul's wealth stems from boxing and business ventures, while Leerdam's comes from Olympic speed skating and sponsorships. Both are actively pursuing their respective careers, with Paul recently engaging in high-profile boxing matches and Leerdam preparing for upcoming international events.

title: TOI's Indian Sportsperson of the Year: Women's World Cup team; three close contenders
content: FIELD OF DREAMS: In 2025, Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana, Deepti Sharma & their band of merry women learnt to believe. In doing so, they taught a thankful nation that when girls in India act on their vision, their wishes usually come true...

title: PAN-Aadhaar link status: How to check it & what happens if you miss Dec 31 deadline?
content: PAN-Aadhaar linking: The Income Tax Department allows PAN‚ÄìAadhaar linking through multiple online options and urges taxpayers to confirm their linking status to keep their PAN active. Failure to complete the process before the deadline could render PAN inoperative from January 1, 2026.

title: Meals, refunds, baggage help: Over 100 flights hit as dense fog blankets Delhi; govt issues advisory
content: Amidst severe fog and low visibility impacting North India's flight operations, the Civil Aviation Ministry has directed airlines to strictly adhere to passenger facilitation norms. Passengers are urged to check flight statuses and allow extra travel time as 118 flights were cancelled and 16 diverted at Delhi airport.

title: 'Fear, corruption have become Bengal's identity: Shah hints at Mamata, TMC; takes 'bhaipo' dig
content: Union home minister Amit Shah accused West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee of not allotting land for border fencing with Bangladesh, leading to infiltration and posing a national security threat. Shah asserted that the BJP will stop infiltration and form the government in West Bengal with a two-thirds majority in the 2026 assembly elections.

title: Eurostar Suspends All Europe Trains After Power Supply Issue
content: Eurostar suspended train services in Europe on Tuesday after a power supply issue in the Channel tunnel, sparking travel chaos for passengers during the very busy New Year period.

title: Asim Munir Marries Daughter To His Brother's Son At Pak Army Headquarters
content: Pakistan Army Chief General Asim Munir's daughter Mahnoor got married on December 26 to her first cousin Abdul Rehman.

title: Biocon Employee, 26, Found Dead At Bengaluru Office
content: A 26-year-old employee of Biocon was found dead on the company premises at Bengaluru's Electronic City Phase-II on Tuesday.

title: "Artistic Freedom": Government Sources On China's Criticism Of Film On Galwan
content: India on Tuesday underlined that there's "artistic freedom" in the country and filmmakers have the right to make films exercising this freedom, government sources said after China said Salman Khan starrer 'Battle of Galwan' "distorts facts".

title: PM Modi Meets Economists At NITI Aayog To Shape Budget 2026 Strategy
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday called for mission-mode reforms across diverse sectors to sustain long-term growth.

title: "Wall-To-Wall" Paving, Mist Sprayers: Inside Delhi's Plan To Curb Pollution
content: As Delhi continues to choke under "very poor" and "severe" air quality, the city government on Tuesday announced a dual action plan to tackle two major pollution sources: dust from broken roads and vehicular emissions.

title: Vacate Yamuna Floodplain By March 2026, Court Tells Delhi Metro
content: The Delhi High Court has restrained the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) from continuing to occupy the Yamuna floodplain area after March 31, 2026.

title: Radio Signals Peace In Manipur As Thadou Tribe Seeks To Resume Live Broadcast
content: The public broadcaster Prasar Bharati has asked the programme head of All India Radio (AIR) or Akashvani in Manipur's capital Imphal for inputs on recruiting staff for resuming live broadcast in the Thadou tribe's language.

title: Centre Warns Online Platforms Against Hosting Illegal Content, Urges Action
content: In an advisory issued on December 29, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has asked these platforms to immediately review their internal compliance frameworks and ensure strict action against illegal and obscene content.

title: Pune Sena Leader Breaks Down Over "Stolen" Form As Nomination Deadline Ends
content: Chaos and intense emotional drama marked the final day of filing nomination papers for the Pune Municipal Corporation elections, as a woman candidate from the Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde faction) alleged her candidacy was sabotaged.

title: Rahul, Priyanka Gandhi In Ranthambore As Rajasthan Tourism Hits Record High
content: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, along with family members, arrived in Ranthambore on Tuesday, as Rajasthan witnesses a sharp increase in tourist footfall across major destinations ahead of the New Year.

title: India's Homegrown Alternative To Foreign Choppers, Dhruv, Takes To Skies
content: Marking a milestone in the country's indigenous aerospace manufacturing, the next generation, multi-role civil helicopter Dhruv NG, billed as an alternative to imported light twin-engine helicopters, made its maiden flight on Tuesday here.

title: Woman Cop Faces Action After Video Abusing Couple In Meerut Goes Viral
content: A woman sub-inspector has been attached to the police lines after a video went viral showing her allegedly misusing her authority and abusing a couple on road in Meerut, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Highlights: "Khaleda Zia's Vision Will Continue To Guide Our Partnership," Says PM Modi
content: Khaleda Zia, former Bangladesh prime minister and the chairperson of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), died after prolonged illness this morning.

title: '1 Slip, Hooked For Life': Hyderabad Woman's Arrest Stresses Warning On Drugs
content: 47-year-old Hassa's journey into narcotics trade progressed from a curious consumer to a regular traveller for a notorious peddler within months of her first use.

title: Delhi Issues New Year's Eve Advisory For Connaught Place, India Gate
content: The Delhi Traffic Police on Tuesday issued a detailed traffic advisory announcing restrictions, diversions and special parking arrangements in Connaught Place and adjoining areas in view of the New Year's Eve celebrations on December 31.

title: "In Heat Of Moment, Confusion": Cop On Tripura Student's Death In Dehradun
content: The fatal attack on Dehradun student Anjel Chakma, 24-year-old from Tirpura, happened in the heat of the moment, a senior cop said Tuesday, adding there was no intention to kill him.

title: TV Smashed, Windows Broken: NCP Workers Vandalise Office After Ticket Snub
content: Upset about being denied a ticket for the upcoming civic polls, a worker from Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar-led NCP and his supporters vandalised the party's office in Nagpur.

title: "Papa, It's Time To Rest": Anjel Chakma Told Father To Retire Before Murder
content: Angel Chakma, the Tripura student who was killed in Dehradun, had big dreams for his family. He recently told his father it was finally time for him to rest because he had worked so hard for them for so long.

title: From BrahMos To Battle Networks: Army's 2025 Push Redefines Precision, Power, Partnerships
content: The Indian Army's transformation in 2025 gathered decisive momentum as long-range precision firepower, high-value aviation inductions, accelerated procurements and sweeping digital reforms converged to reshape its combat edge.

title: Naidu delivering results-driven governance, says TDP Andhra Pradesh president
content: Palla Srinivasa Rao says Chief Minister restored public trust through accountability; party to launch grassroots outreach on welfare schemes

title: Himachal apple growers oppose reduced import duty on New Zealand apples
content: In a memorandum, apple growers urge the Governor to safeguard livelihoods, they say that lower import duties on New Zealand apples will adversely affect the industry in Himachal Pradesh

title: At peace meeting, Inam Veerapur elders say honour killing unfortunate
content: The village recently witnessed an honour killing in which a pregnant woman was killed by her family for marrying outside caste

title: FemiRides transforms women‚Äôs mobility and safety
content: The women-for-women mobility platform, founded in 2020 by Behara Vijaya Radhika, is quietly reshaping how women travel while also creating opportunities for them to earn

title: Chilly weather triggers a surge in tourism, Munnar witnesses hours-long traffic blocks
content: The traffic crisis turned fatal on Sunday when a 35-year-old man died after the vehicle transporting him got stuck in a snarl

title: Koli Kabbaligas stage protest seeking Scheduled Tribes status
content: Around 3,000 people from various parts of the district participate in a march raising slogans against the State government

title: ED flags ‚Çπ2,883-crore liquor scam in Chhattisgarh involving bureaucrats and politicians
content: Probe finds alleged large-scale manipulation of excise policy, illegal commissions, and off-the-books liquor sales between 2019 and 2023

title: Thrissur Mayor unveils vision for a people-centric, future-ready city
content: At her first meet-the-press, Niji Justin promises transparent governance, inclusive urban development and decisive action on roads, waste management, women‚Äôs safety and street dog menace

title: Medical camp opens for Sabarimala pilgrims in Kumily
content: The camp will operating until January 15 with 24-hour service during peak pilgrimage days. It will offer a variety of treatments including allopathy, ayurveda, homoeopathy, and siddha.

title: Sabarimala temple opens for Makaravilakku
content: Security arrangements have been significantly stepped up, with a 1,593 member police force deployed under the leadership of Crime Branch Superintendent of Police M. Krishnan

title: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to inagurate Vibe 4 Wellness campaign on January 1
content: A Health departments survey puts the prevalence of hypertension in Kerala at 34% and that of diabetes at 24%  among adults above 30 years of age. Data from the India Hypertension Control Initiative, which is being implemented in the State suggests that roughly one-third of the adult  population has hypertension.

title: Stadium, ring road, and hospital upgrade among priorities, says Koothattukulam municipal chief
content: Regi John Plathottathil has outlined a five-point development agenda, which will serve as the focal point during his initial days as chairperson of the municipality

title: Police conduct final inspection ahead of New Year Eve celebrations
content: The police have directed pubs and bars to close by 1 a.m.; as many as 50 flyovers across Bengaluru will be closed as part of traffic regulation measures

title: Defence Ministry inks ‚Çπ4,666-croree contracts for battle carbines, torpedoes
content: The contracts were inked in the presence of Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh at South Block, New Delhi, officials said

title: Madurai to enter Twin Cities Partnership with Camberley for cultural exchange and educational collaboration
content: Camberley is the home town of Colonel John¬†Pennycuick, the British engineer who built the¬†Mullaperiyar¬†Dam. Mayor of Surrey Heath Louise¬†Ashbery¬†will visit¬†Madurai¬†and¬†Theni¬†during the¬†Pongal¬†and sign the agreement with the¬†Madurai¬†Corporation Commissioner

title: CPI(M) turns to Kumarakom to bolster narrative of Cong.-BJP collusion
content: Party asks Congress whether it has the courage to expel those who engineered alleged collusion to manipulate the mandate in Kumarakom panchayat. The dramatic power shift in the local body last week saw an Independent assume charge as president with the backing of UDF and three BJP members

title: Sanskrit university Syndicate members flag concerns over revenue from KCA cricket stadium project
content: Lack of clarity on revenue earnings for the university in return for providing free user rights on the land to the cricketing body for a period of 33 years. The KCA will develop/construct multi-sports facilities, including a football ground with an athletic track, say university officials

title: HAL enters civil helicopter market as Dhruv NG completes inaugural flight
content: Designed and manufactured in India, Dhruv NG is a 5.5-tonne, light twin-engine, multi-role helicopter, engineered to operate across diverse and challenging Indian terrains

title: As 2025 bows out, Kolkatans say there is nothing to cheer about
content: The ‚ÄòCity of Joy‚Äô appears to be bracing for 2026, when many fear the forthcoming Assembly election could create a communal divide, a blow to the eastern metropolis‚Äôs tradition of harmony

title: Mavelikara court acquits accused in Vishal murder case
content: 20 people, including one minor, were charge-sheeted in the case. Of these, 19 faced trial and were acquitted by the court

title: Kaneri Math seer defends his use of language against Lingayat seers
content: He says that the words he uttered are commonly used words in colloquial language in North Karnataka region

title: Chittoor district records 26 per cent drop in crime rate in 2025
content: SP attributes the improvement to strengthened community policing, focused enforcement, and extensive use of technology

title: DGP‚Äôs remarks show collapse of policing in Andhra Pradesh: YSRCP
content: The party Legal Cell working president alleges political pressure on police, selective enforcement of law and sharp fall in State police performance under coalition government

title: BJP and Shiv Sena finalise 143-8 formula for Nagpur civic polls, NCP to go solo
content: Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) constituents, the Congress and NCP (SP), have decided to contest the Nagpur civic polls separately.

title: Kanakadasa‚Äôs works embody universal human consciousness, says scholar
content: Mallepuram G. Venkatesh delivers lecture on ‚ÄòSaint Kanakadasa and Universal Human Consciousness‚Äô organised in Kaginele

title: Temples are remembered when polls approach, Chouhan takes dig at Mamata on Mahakal temple plan
content: Temples and religious rituals are matters of faith, but some Opposition parties use religion solely for electoral gains, says Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan.

title: Global spice routes conclave to unveil heritage network
content: The three-day event to be held in Kochi from January 6 will explore new ways to strengthen cultural and heritage tourism among a host of countries which are part the famed global trade corridor

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Mumbai civic polls: Congress ally VBA fails to get candidates in 20 seats
content: With deadline for filing nominations for the January 15 elections ending on December 30, the VBA 'disclosure' may require Congress to rework the poll strategy

title: Political theatre unfolds after Surendran‚Äôs questioning by SIT in the Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Mr. Surendran dodged pointed questions about whether he had blamed former TDB president A Padmakumar, another CPI(M) leader.¬†Earlier, Mr. Padmakumar had stirred controversy by dropping hints about the alleged role of some ‚Äúsaintly higher-up‚Äù in the crime.

title: Supreme Court to take up petition to treat racial slur as a separate category of hate crime
content: The new set of laws hardly addresses the issue of racial violence against Indian citizens, especially from the north-eastern States, says petitioner

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT questions Dindigal-based businessperson with alleged links to illegal antique trade
content: Officials said the SIT suspects its investigation might meander into interstate rackets that palm off ordinary everyday objects, including metal pots and idols, as rare treasures with magical properties to unsophisticated, overeager wealthy collectors for significant sums of money.¬†

title: Nainar Nagenthran alleges dilution of Horticulture Department‚Äôs functioning
content: The BJP‚Äôs Tamil Nadu president says the ruling DMK has ‚Äúswindled‚Äù ‚Çπ141 crore through alleged scams in the department, and is trying to make it a wing of the Agriculture Department

title: Silent march to be taken out on January 5 against honour killing in Hubballi
content: The march will begin from the Siddharoodha Math and culminate in a public meeting at Nehru Maidan where an appeal will be made to society to prevent such incidents

title: Large crowds throng Vaishnava temples in Mysuru on Vaikunta Ekadasi
content: In most temples, entry for darshan commenced around 6 a.m. and continued uninterrupted throughout the day.

title: SIT questions former Devaswom Minister Kadakampally Surendran and former TDB president P. Prasanth in the Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Surendran reportedly told the SIT that the government‚Äôs role in TDB administration was limited to policy and sweeping administrative oversight, primarily through the Revenue department‚Äôs Devaswom wing.¬†

title: India has boarded the ‚ÄòReforms Express‚Äô, says PM Modi in year-ender post
content: The Prime Minister said the government moved ahead decisively with higher ambition, faster execution and deeper transformation

title: FIR against Bengaluru PG owner, manager after techie killed in cylinder blast
content: According to the police, preliminary probe revealed that a gas leak was detected around 2 p.m., but it was allegedly ignored. There was also no proper ventilation in the building

title: Court issues non-bailable warrant against activist Mahesh Shetty Thimarody
content: The court rejected the application filed by Thimarody‚Äôs counsel seeking exemption from appearance. Observing that no grounds were made for his absence, the court issued a non-bailable warrant against Thimarody.

title: Security forces launch search operations in Kishtwar, Poonch over reports of possible terrorist movement
content: Troops used drones and other aerial surveillance equipment to monitor the area in a bid to track down the terrorists

title: Shoba Narayan‚Äôs Namma Bangalore 2.0: A thank-you note to the city
content: Shoba Narayan‚Äôs¬†Namma Bangalore 2.0: Culture, Coding, Cuisine, Creativity¬†, a sequel to her best-selling¬†Namma Bangalore: The Soul of a Metropolis, tells a reader how to be a Bengalurean.

title: Visually impaired students in Karnataka can now use computers to write SSLC and II PUC exams
content: The use of computer will be limited to only typing answers and the candidate will have to bring his/her own computer or laptop duly formatted to the exam centre.

title: 11 arrested in Assam, Tripura for links with Bangladesh radical group
content: Police said they are members of the Imam Mahmuder Kafila, an offshoot of the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh

title: SIR process for Uttar Pradesh gets extended again
content: The draft list is to be published on January 6, and the final list on March 6, the Election Commission of India (ECI) said

title: SC must stop retrospective environmental approvals, Sariska boundary revision: Jairam Ramesh
content: Jairam Ramesh said the National Green Tribunal‚Äôs power has been thoroughly diluted over the past decade.

title: Chenchus get opportunity to have sparsha darshan of Mallikarjuna Swamy
content: Chenchu tribals consider Lord Mallikarjuna as their son-in-law and have been associated with the history of Srisailam for long

title: Winners and losers: Maye, Henry shine in fantasy finals; Gibbs, Lamb disappoint
content: the 2025 fantasy football season is championship week in most leagues . it featured standout performances by Drake Maye , Derrick Henry and Chase Brown . the fantasy stars included jahmyr Gibbs , Josh Jacobs and ceeDee Lamb .

title: ACC preview: Final Four contenders, more March Madness predictions
content: the 18-team league received its lowest number of NCAA bids in more than a decade . it hasn't been a top-three conference since before 2020 . the ACC had eight top-40 teams in 2019 compared to last season's four .
